Uses of Class
robowars.board.HexCoord

  • Packages that use HexCoord 
    Package Description
    robowars.board  
    robowars.display  
    robowars.flow

    • Uses of HexCoord in robowars.board

      Methods in robowars.board that return HexCoord 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HexCoord[] Board.getPieceCoords() 
      Methods in robowars.board that return types with arguments of type HexCoord 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<HexCoord> Board.scanArea(PieceEnum scanningPieceType, HexCoord scanLocation)
      This method takes in the enumeration that represents the piece that is performing the scan operation and the target coordinate of the hexagon space, which must be a valid coordinate, that is being scanned and then returns a list of HexCoord elements representing the coordinates that are determined to be occupied.
      java.util.List<HexCoord> Board.scanCurrentArea()
      Scans the area around the current piece
      Methods in robowars.board with parameters of type HexCoord 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Board.hexIsWithinMovementRange(HexCoord hex, Piece piece)
      Method for checking if the hexagon is within the movement range of the current playing piece?
      boolean Board.hexIsWithinVisibleRange(HexCoord hex, Piece piece)
      Is the hex visible to the piece?
      boolean Board.isInBounds(HexCoord coord)
      Checks whether a coordinate is within the bounds of the board coordinates
      boolean HexCoord.isSameAs(HexCoord coord)
      Compares if the two coordinates are the same.
      boolean Board.isValidAction(EntryEnum action, HexCoord hex)
      This method determines whether a hex is a valid place to move for the active piece.
      void Board.movePiece(HexCoord coord)
      Moves the current playing piece to the specified coordinate
      int Board.relativeDirection(Piece piece, HexCoord from, HexCoord to)
      Method for getting the relative direction value of a piece, called by the Interpreter so robots can scan properly.
      java.util.List<HexCoord> Board.scanArea(PieceEnum scanningPieceType, HexCoord scanLocation)
      This method takes in the enumeration that represents the piece that is performing the scan operation and the target coordinate of the hexagon space, which must be a valid coordinate, that is being scanned and then returns a list of HexCoord elements representing the coordinates that are determined to be occupied.
      java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> Board.scanSpace(HexCoord coord)
      This method takes in one coordinate of a hexagon space, which must be valid coordinate, and returns a list of pieces determined to be occupying the space.
      void Board.setPieceCoords(HexCoord[] pieceCoords) 
      void Board.shootSpace(HexCoord targetHex)
      This method is called when a player attempts to shoot at a hexagon space.
      int Board.shortestDistance(HexCoord coord1, HexCoord coord2)
      Give two hexCoords, this method figures out the shortestDistance (minimum number of hex-Coords) between the two hexCoords.
